content:
Art. 4.52. 
Effects of the benefit of the inventory 
The benefit of the inventory has the effect of preventing the commingling of estates, both as regards the heir and the creditors and legatees.
The heir retains against the succession the rights he had against the deceased. He is liable for the debts and charges of the succession only in respect of the property he receives.   
Creditors of the succession and legatees are paid out of these assets in preference to the heir's personal creditors.
